p: Biomass fast pyrolysis has gained enormous attention because of its potential to generate large amounts of bio-oil, which is an alternative to liquid fossil fuels. A detailed analysis of bio-oil suggests the presence of a variety of organic acids, aldehydes, ketones, phenols, guaiacols, and syringols, which are considered to be speciality chemicals [ [1], [2], [3]]. The composition of bio-oil depends primarily on the feedstock and process parameters such as temperature, residence time, biomass particle sizes and reactor configuration [ [2], [3], [4], [5], [6], [7]]. A thorough understanding of the process parameters and biomass composition influencing fast pyrolysis product distribution is needed to optimize the process for large-scale applications.
